intro: Onosma tanaitica, commonly known as the Tanaitic hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard species. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and often covered in fine hairs. Onosma tanaitica is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
